page.title: 06HOUSING - GODSHILL
page.content: The oldest houses in Godshill are the 15th and 16th Century thatched cottages around Church Hill. The village next began to grow along the main Ventnor-Newport Road where the pretty cottages now form the basis of the tourist industry as gift shops, tea rooms etc. From 1960 Godshill grew at a great rate, when several estates were built, mainly to house young families, but some for old people. To provide housing at as cheap a rate as possible, the houses on one estate were built as shells, the fittings being left to the purchaser to provide. A second large estate of about 70 houses was built for private sale, but were taken over by the local authority when few sold. They are now mainly occupied by Council tenants, a small number still privately owned.
